p.s: Burning MP3 files to CD allows you to listen to your favorite tunes in CD players , which is convenient for those who lack digital media players and MP3 players .
MP3 files can be burned to CD in most popular music player applications , including iTunes , Windows Media Player , RealPlayer , and Winamp .

list.item:
Launch iTunes and click on “ File .
”

Click on “ New ” and select “ Playlist .
”

item.s: Type a name for the playlist , then drag and drop songs from your iTunes library into the playlist window on the right .
You must have a playlist created before you can burn songs to CD .
Insert a blank CD-R disc into the optical disc drive in your computer .

Select your playlist and click on “ File .
”

list.item: Select “ Burn Playlist to Disc , ” then select either “ Audio CD ” or “ MP3 CD ” as the disc format , based on your preference .

item.s:
Click on “ Burn .
”
The process will take up to several minutes to complete , and iTunes will notify you when burning is complete .
If your playlist is too large to fit on disc , iTunes will prompt you to insert another disc to finish the burning process .

list.item: Launch Windows Media Player and click on the “ Burn ” tab .

item.s: Drag and drop songs and playlists into the burn list on the right .
The songs must be added to the burn list in the order in which you want them listed on the CD .
Insert a blank CD-R disc into the optical disc drive in your computer .
Click on the burn tab at the top right corner .
The icon resembles a piece of paper with a green checkmark .

Select “ Audio CD , ” then click on “ Start Burn .
”
The process will take up to several minutes , and Windows Media Player will eject the CD when burning is complete .

list.item: Launch RealPlayer and click on the “ Burn ” tab .

item.s: Select “ Audio CD Burner , ” then insert a blank CD-R into the disc drive in your computer .
Click on “ Burn ” at the top of RealPlayer .
Click on “ Select CD Type ” under Tasks in the right sidebar .

Select “ Audio CD ” or “ MP3 CD , ” then click on “ OK .
”

list.item:
Click on “ Add Tracks from my Library , ” then select “ All Music .
”

Drag and drop tracks from the left into the burn list on the right .
RealPlayer will keep you updated as to how much space is remaining on the disc as you move tracks to the burn list .

item.s:
Click on “ Burn Your CD .
”
The process will take up to several minutes to complete , and notify you when the CD has been burned successfully .

list.item: Launch Winamp and insert a blank CD-R into the disc drive in your computer .

item.s:
Click on “ View ” and select “ Media Library .
”

list.item: Select “ Blank Disk ” from the list under Media Library , then click on “ Add ” at the bottom of the Winamp window .

item.s: Select the playlist you want burned , or click on “ Files ” or “ Folders ” to search for music .

Select the tracks you want burned to CD , then click on “ OK .
”

list.item:
Click on “ Burn ” at the bottom of Winamp , then select “ Enable Burn-proof mode .
”

Click on “ Burn ” in the Burn dialog box .
The process will take up to several minutes to complete , and Winamp will notify you when the CD has been burned successfully .

item.s: When selecting a disc format , opt for “ MP3 CD ” if you want hundreds of songs burned to CD versus an average of 20 songs to CD .
MP3 files can be compressed more efficiently than other file types , which allows for hundreds of audio tracks to be burned to a single disc .
